instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A2179 does not boot after installing a water-damaged IO board
threads.message:
hello i have 820-01958
get 20v 0.35ma
screen dont turn on
the fan is spinning on maximum speed
ppvcc_s0 1.8v
PPVCCIN_AUX_PCH 1.8v
PPVCCIN_AUX_PCH 1.8v
CPUVR_PGOOD 1.8v
PLT_RST_L 0v

The board was booting fine without an I/O board, but when i tried a water-damaged I/O board, the board stopped to boot.
Maybe the T2 chip is dead?

threads.title: A2179 does not boot after installing a water-damaged IO board
threads.message:
Possibly...
Now check diode mode readings on T2 data lines connected to J6100.
